abstract.p: Roster changes for US men's national soccer teamnoted (S)

block.p: Desperate for points after two disappointing matches last month, Bruce Arena, the coach of the United States men's national team, yesterday shuffled his 18-man roster for next week's critical World Cup qualifying match against Barbados.

Arena named six new players to the team, including two strikers who are coming back from injuries: Joe-Max Moore (Everton) and Brian McBride (Columbus Crew). Moore is coming back from a knee injury and McBride from a broken cheekbone.

Desperate for points after two disappointing matches last month, Bruce Arena, the coach of the United States men's national team, yesterday shuffled his 18-man roster for next week's critical World Cup qualifying match against Barbados.

Arena named six new players to the team, including two strikers who are coming back from injuries: Joe-Max Moore (Everton) and Brian McBride (Columbus Crew). Moore is coming back from a knee injury and McBride from a broken cheekbone.
The other new additions are goalkeeper Tony Meola (Kansas City Wizards), Jeff Agoos (D.C. United), Carlos Llamosa (D.C. United) and John O'Brien (Ajax).

The MetroStars midfielder Tab Ramos remains with the team, but Arena dropped Ramos's teammate, Clint Mathis, who did not play in either of the United States' first two matches, a 1-1 draw in Guatemala and a 2-1 loss in Costa Rica. After two away matches, the Americans play the next three qualifiers at home, beginning with Wednesday's match against Barbados in Foxboro, Mass.
